greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Product_{p prime} (1 - 1/(p+1)^2).
comment: The probablity that two randomly chosen squarefree numbers are coprime. - _Amiram Eldar_, Aug 04 2020
link: G. Niklasch, Some number theoretical constants: 1000-digit values. [Cached copy]
László Tóth, The unitary analogue of Pillai's arithmetical function, Collectanea Mathematica, Vol. 40, No. 1 (1989), pp. 19-30.
formula: Equals lim_{n->oo} (Pi^2/(3*n^2*log(n))) * Sum_{k=1..n} A145388(k). - _Amiram Eldar_, May 14 2019
mathematica: digits = 98; Exp[NSum[(-1)^n*(2^(n-1)-2)*PrimeZetaP[n-1]/(n-1), {n, 3, Infinity}, WorkingPrecision -> 2 digits, Method -> "AlternatingSigns"]] // RealDigits[#, 10, digits]& // First (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 18 2016 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 19 2001
ext: Definition corrected by Dan Asimov, Apr 15 2006
